full_summary:
# RFP for ISP Review Services
## Solicitation Number: 20222456-IRB
## Publication Date: July 19, 2023
## Closing Date: August 22, 2023, 2:00 PM EST

The Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada (IRB) is issuing an Invitation to Tender (ITT) for the provision of Interpreter Services Program (ISP) review services under the Task and Solution Professional Services (TSPS) arrangement. The objective of this requirement is to engage a qualified service provider to review the ISP and provide recommendations on its operations and delivery.

## Background
The IRB requires a consultant to review its ISP and identify opportunities for improvement. The consultant will assess the program's effectiveness, security, and efficiency, and provide recommendations on how to enhance its operations.

## Requirements
- Review the ISP's effectiveness, security, and efficiency
- Identify opportunities for improvement and provide corresponding recommendations
- Assess the program's delivery model, including considerations for outsourcing
- Develop a comprehensive report with findings and recommendations

## Contract Value and Period
The estimated contract value is CA$3,750,000 (Tier 1 - Level 3). The contract period is expected to be from the contract award date to March 31, 2024.

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation will be based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

## Eligibility
The requirement is open to Supply Arrangement (SA) holders with a Tier 1 qualification (CA$0 to CA$3,750,000) under the E60ZT-18TTSPS arrangement. The following SA holders have been invited to bid:

- Accenture Inc
- ADGA Group Consultants Inc
- BDO Canada LLP
- Creative File LP
- Deloitte Inc
- Global Advantage Consulting Group Inc
- Gov Insights Consulting Inc.
- Goss Gilroy Inc
- Isheva Inc Ranakan Inc in JOINT VENTURE
- Kelly Sears Consulting Group
- KPMG LLP
- Makwa Resourcing Inc TPG Technology Consulting Limited JV
- Raymond Chabot Grant Thornton Consulting Inc
- Spearhead Management Canada Ltd.
- Talent Transformation Group Inc
- The Aim Group Inc.

## Trade Agreements
This requirement is subject to various trade agreements, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and others.
